title: MAG 072 - Takeaway Transcript
text:
MAG – 072 – Takeaway 
Content Warnings 
• Cannibalism 
• Food 
• Graphic injury & violence 
• Blood & gore 
• Torture 
• Human remains 
• Murder 
Discussions of: breaking & entering, body mutilation, child abuse, 
hallucinations 
Mentions of: religion, cult, knives, racism, burning buildings, self harm 
SFX: electrical distortion, low drone 
[The Magnus Archives Theme – Intro] 
JONATHAN SIMS 
Rusty Quill presents: The Magnus Archives. Episode seventy-two. Takeaway. 
[The Magnus Archives Theme – Continues] 
ARCHIVIST 
Could you say that again? I’ve put you on speaker 
BASIRA 
[Basira’s voice is coming through a speaker on a phone for this whole 
conversation] 

Maxwell Rayner. Have you heard of him? 
ARCHIVIST 
Yes. Why? 
BASIRA 
Who is he? 
ARCHIVIST 
He was a cult leader back in the Nineties. I don’t know about now. 
BASIRA 
The Church of the People? 
ARCHIVIST 
The People’s Church of the Divine Host. 
BASIRA 
Right. 
ARCHIVIST 
Is he involved in a case or something? 
BASIRA 
We’re on our way to arrest him. (Pause) 
Hello? 
ARCHIVIST 
No I’m... Yes, I’m here. You’ve found him? 

BASIRA 
Not me, but I’m one of the ones going in. There’s a lot of sectioned guys here, 
so I thought I’d give you a call. Any advice? 
ARCHIVIST 
Bring torches. 
BASIRA 
Torches? 
ARCHIVIST 
As many as you can get your hands on. How many do you have? 
BASIRA 
Um, there’s a firearms team here, so we should have plenty of tactical lights. 
So you reckon it’s going to get dark? 
[The phone line gets some interference, distorting Basira’s voice] 
ARCHIVIST 
Basira? Hello? 
BASIRA 
[Basira’s voice is hard to understand because of the interference] 
Jon? Jon? Can you hear me? 
[There’s a beep as the phone cuts off] 
ARCHIVIST 

Oh... damn. Right. (Sigh) 
Statement of Craig Goodall, regarding his explorations of an abandoned 
chicken and kebab shop in Walthamstow. Original statement given 20th 
October 2009. Audio recording by Jonathan Sims, Head Archivist of the 
Magnus Institute, London. 
Statement begins. 
ARCHIVIST (STATEMENT) 
I feel like I should be upfront with this right at the beginning. I’m probably a 
cannibal. I don’t know for sure, but the likelihood is high. You ever hear of Han 
Yong? Otherwise known as John Haan? I guess it depends on what corners of 
the Internet you lurk in or what tabloids you were reading in 2004. If you 
haven’t, let me explain. John Haan ran a small takeaway on Higham Hill Road in 
Walthamstow. 
Weirdly enough, it wasn’t a Chinese; it just served kebab, chicken, burgers... 
the usual. Well, it went out of business in May 2004 when Mr. Haan was 
arrested for murdering his wife, Lanying. So far, so mundane, right? Except for 
the fact that over the previous two weeks John Haan had been disposing of the 
body the way only a takeaway owner can. He went full-on Sweeny Todd. 
Now, the thing is, I live just off Higham Hill Road, and I used to go to that 
takeaway all the time. I definitely went there a few times in May 2004. I 
haven’t been able to find out from any of the news reports exactly what he 
was selling the meat as, but over the course of the month I definitely had 
chicken wings, doner kebab, chicken kebab and a burger, so there’s a very 
good chance I ate some of her. It’s weird, though, everything I’ve found online
